column4: hi all, i have a quick question i hope i can get help with.. i have a IT812x secondary pata controller, and i booted up the breezy cd and it does not find it.. i know this driver was in 2.6.13 -- if i install breezy, is there a 2.6.13 update available?
i'd really appreciate it if someone can tell me whether there is a 2.6.13 update available in breezy...
There is not. 2.6.12-9 is teh latest.
how would i get my IT812x controller to work then? do i have to wait till the next release?
correct. driver was merged into kernel on 2.6.13
Then I'm afraid you'll need a custom compiled kernel.
this i can do. does ubuntu provide patchsets and configs that i could use against 2.6.13 by any chance?
and if not, does kernel-package work in ubuntu like in debian?
I think they don't; they DO provide a patch set for an already-ubuntu kernel, but that won't necessarily work on a vanilla kernel. make-kpkg works fine, though.
great. does ubuntu use any special kernel features that would not be in vanilla then?
Yep. The main one is breezy is usplash (bootup progress bar)
so i guess building off vanilla 2.6.13 would require some patching eh.. hmph..
I'm not sure how extensively the kernel is patched for restricted-modules (nvidia, ati etc) support.
true. crap.. i guess i'll have to wait till a 2.6.13 comes out on breezy -- or.. will one ever? ..
If their update policy is the same as debian, then no.
Mind you, that does _not_ mean you wouldn't be able to run the 2.6.13 kernel from Dapper Drake ;-)
Is the it* the only controller the mobo has?
no but my ICH7 pata is full and i have disks on the ITE chipset.
